newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RESEARCH ALERT-Lend Lease seen a buy.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RESEARCH ALERT-Lend Lease seen a buy.

text.p: Brisbane-based broking house Morgan Stockbroking Ltd was recommending Lend Lease Corp Ltd as a buy, saying all indications were that the group's buoyant performance would continue.

"Recommendation is buy. (There is) an improved property workload, increasing financial services business and opportunities to use its expertise in Asia and related areas," Morgan analyst Greg Cathro said in a research report.
"These are all indications that the above-average performance of the company will continue," Cathro said.

Cathro said the net profit result of A$280 million in the year ended June 30, 1996 was marginally below expectations but included some conservative one-off items which, on balance, tended to understate the performance.
Cathro forecast Lend Lease's net profit rising to $325 million in the current 1996/97 year with total fully-franked dividends of 96 cents a share compared to the 90 cents in 1995/96.

"The company is expanding into Asia, has formed a joint venture with IBM to provide information out-sourcing services in Australasia and is seeking ways to use its skills in new infrastructure projects," Cathro said.

"The outlook for the company remains positive," he said. Financial services operations were forecast to achieve double-digit growth over the next three years with gains arising in a competitive environment from a planned 40 percent reduction in costs over the period, Cathro said.

"The company has established itself as a consistent growth investment with a conservative financial position," Cathro said. "It deserves to sell at a premium to sharemarket average valuation ratios," he said.
